content.detailedDescription:
At around 11:50pm to 12:00 am beginning the 24th of september, i stepped out on my back porch to have a smoke break while watching t.V. i live in collinsville, ok which is not too far from the tulsa international airport. i am used to seeing planes fly in and take off regularly around here as the airport is only 10-15 minutes away. tonight was a very clear sky, i live in tulsa county, outside city limits in the country, i am able to see the whole sky, stars and all very clearly. but when i stepped out tonight, i'm not sure what i saw. i'm used to seeing planes plinking their white lights and security lights or what have you, when they are in the sky, and pretty much it's a given when you see those blinking lights accompanied some times with the sound of an aircraft.

but tonight was different.

i stepped out on my back porch looking west. i saw what i thought was a bright star blinking or what have you, as i can see several of those out here in the country at night.

as i looked at this thing, i believed this blinking thing was just an aircraft from the north west going to land at the tulsa international airport as it was traveling in the south to south east direction.

couple seconds later passed and it looked like it had no intentions of slowing down.

in a few minutes, it was gone.. but the weird thing is... i'm accustomed to the arrangement of the stars on a clear night, as i have lived here for 23 years now. the two stars that it passed, i'll describe as 2/3 of a triangle. the bottom left point had always been there, and so had the top point, and now all of a sudden i saw the bottom right point pure red and pulsating/blinking white. it looked like a perfect formation for a couple of minutes. then it was all gone, and then i saw a shooting star right behind it coming sharply from the east.

but as this "thing" went from the nw to west and then south so quickly.. i do not know was it was. it was too quick for any aircraft traveling that quick, especially as it was only as bright as the brightest star, or brighter that you can see at night.

description:  tulsa county.

date: sept.23 2011
where: tulsa county, oklahoma.

what: red bright ball that had the size of a bright star, but did not move like it was a star. it moved quickly from my view(collinsville, ok) from the nw to s in a matter of minutes then out of sight, pulsating white every other second. saw the completion of a triangle which pulsated red to white as i saw this "object" move over it, completing this triangle of stars which i have only seen in these many years to just be 2 stars.

i am sorry, i have no witnesses, as no one else was awake. but this was a first for me as i can not explain what i have just seen an hour ago. it is one thing to see an aircraft in the sky blinking it's security lights and you automatically know it is an aircraft, but a pure red ball, that blinks white and moved that fast across the sky.. i have no explanation.
content.summary: Stepped out my porch to for a quick smoke break. saw  red ball that looked like a star. do not know what i saw as it disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: 9:58pm i walked my girlfriend out to her car to say goodnight and noticed a very bright star-like light in the southwest sky; we were standing in the driveway of my house with no obstructions from our viewpoint. it was a very bright light similar to a star and i was trying to figure out if it was a star or perhaps a planet like venus; it was stationary and did not move. then after a couple of minutes it got very dim and then it blinked out and vanished. there were no other stars or lights in the sky. there were no aircraft in the sky. there were some partial scattered clouds but that's all. the light has not re-appeared again since. it was very odd and strange and it made the hairs on the back of my neck stand up straight. i have never seen a light just go dim and blink out like that. it was almost like someone turned off a flashlight in the sky. very strange incident.
content.summary: Bright stationary light in the sky that went dim and blinked out

content.detailedDescription:
I was waiting tables at menchies restaurant in amarillo, texas when a customer walked in stating he had witnessed 2 bright balls in the sky.  by the time i got outside 1 had disappeared.  coming back outside within 5 minutes later we both witnessed 2 balls of light in the n western sky. we also had a couple calls and text messages coming in of witnessed reports.  a couple felt it had to do with the falling satellite. i did not feel this was the case obviosly and certainly not a weather ballon as someone thought our local channel 10 news might have already reported.  the balls disappeared and reappeared more than once- at least 3 times over a 20 minute period between 9-10pm september 23rd 2011. i had no particular feelings other than wandering what these objects really were.  thank you,  

[personal information removed/cms/tg]
content.summary: 2  fairly bright round balls of light appear,disapear and reapear in 20 minutes

content.detailedDescription:
At about 2130 hrs, i observed a bright light in the eastern sky above fillmore, utah at about 45 degrees above the horizon. after observing the object for about 30 minutes it did not appear to be moving. i then used 10x40 binoculars to observe the object. when viewed through the binoculars, which i rested on my truck to avoid movement, it appeared to be a bright white light, and on either side of it were four smaller objects that also appeared to be stationary lined up at a 5 degree angle from the horizontal. they appeared to be lit up by the object. i could not see any other stars in the vicinity of the object. the object appeared to be stationary. i observed the object for an additional half hour but it did not appear to move. during this same time frame, i watched several planes flying either east or west and north and south along which appeared to be flying at a much lower altitude than the object, and they had the typical blinking lights. the sky was moonless, and we do not have street lights on our block, so the area is dark and bright lights in the sky are noticeable, and since we are in the flight path between hill air force base and the air force base at las vegas i am used to seeing routine aircraft flights at night. this object stood out because of its brightness in the dark sky. the smaller objects on either side were not visible with the naked eye, but only through the binoculars.
at 1050 hours i checked the location of the object and it appeared to be higher above the horizon than earlier. it still has the smaller lights on either side of it. it is most likely some object in orbit.
content.summary: Bright light east of fillmore utah, appears stationary in nature

content.detailedDescription: Very dark black, upright 8x14ft rectangular with flared bottem, hard defined edges yet inside blacked out beyond normal for lighting.  flew with purpose at around 200mph.  stayed on well defined, smooth path.  no sound. approx. 20:20 on 9/23/11, bozeman, mt
content.summary: Ve

content.detailedDescription: My friends and i were standing outside, gazing at the stars.  then we saw the re-entering satellite streak across the sky at incredible speed.  we stood, amazed at what we had just seen, and looked at the last spot we had seen it.  no less than 5 minutes later, i witnessed a triangle-shaped object move across the sky in the opposite direction of the satellite.  i called my friend over, but by the time he looked, it had vanished.  perhaps no more than 7 minutes later, he pointed out an object that was almost similar to the satellite, but was moving north to south, rather than the west to east as the satellite had.  mere sconds later, about 15 objects of the same approximate shape and size appeared in the same direction, almost as if they were chasing it.  then another "flock" appeared.  the term "flock" refers to that we almost thought they looked like glowing birds,  but they were flying about in what might have been a figure-8, had they not been following the first object.  i rode my bike home as fast as i could and told my family, and then made this report.
content.summary: Many ariplane-shaped object with erractic flight patterns

content.detailedDescription: 9:20 pm, looked out my kitchen sliding glass door towards the south-west and saw a unwavering steady-on red light in the sky, about airplane altitude, moving slowly towards the south-west, being paralleled by a plane with a flashing beacon light on it. the plane appeared to be approximately 1000 feet from the red light and followed along the entire time i watched. when i saw them, they were several miles away from my location. as i watched the red light, what looked like a meteor, like a streak of yellow-orange light, came from the left out of the dark sky, again like a meteor, and ended at the red light. the path of the "meteor" light did not waver. it was straight into the red light. i told a friend who was with me to look at it, and he saw the red light but was too late to see the light streak. we watched them slowly head s-w for approximately 5 more minutes until both the red light and the plane went below the roof lines of the near-by houses.
content.summary: Moving red light being chased by plane (parallel). witnessed what looked like a meteor (light streak) come from left went into red light. light continued on.

content.detailedDescription:
Hi,
 
this is my first time to the mufon website and of course, i joined right away.
 
i was recently viewing a web cam by; catfood webcam videos, world timelapse video.  at 1:51 minutes into the video, a block dot appeared in the sky cam and it disappeared rapidly.  i thought i���������d pass it on to you and see if it could be anything.  perhaps it was just a bug flying in front of the camera.  i���������ll leave it up to you. 
 
[link moved to investigation report area/cms/tg]
 
again, it was very quick and appeared at 1:51 minutes/seconds into this video. object seen twice, again at 1:52 minutes/seconds, then changes to another video cam.  very brief, but definitely seen twice briefly.
 
thank you,
[name removed/cms/tg]

ps. i had to enter a country, state, etc. but that is not where the object was viewed.  location/time is unknown.
content.summary: Object observed on world timelapse video cam, location unknown

content.detailedDescription: Low on the horizon, i saw a series of red light moving from the south to the north. at first i went out to smoke and then notice 20-30 red lights headed north bound. i ran inside to grab my video camera and ran back out and notice the number of lights was less about 10 and they seemed to be forming into a v shape and then slowly disappeared. this took place in north oklahoma city, looking east. i do have video footage. all i have to say is that it was exciting yet frighten...
content.summary: A series of red lights moving from south to north.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
i was pulling up to subway when i thought i observed some flares flying in the air directly over my house, which is approximately three hundred meters down the road.  wright patterson afb is near my house but they never drop flares in dayton, ohio so i immediately parked and stepped out of my car to investigate further.

     i witnessed five lights about 40 degrees off the horizon flying from south to north.  the lights were about the size of a baby aspirin and were gold/yellow in appearance.  sort of like a dim fire.  the lights were flying in a formation unknown to me.  one was in front, the next three followed approximately 10 arc degrees behind the first light in a diagonal, top left to bottom right.  the fifth light followed approx. 10 arc degrees from the fourth light but was on the same plane as the first light.

     i sat back in my car and turned the ignition off so i could listen for their sound.  they made no sound.  another man was standing out front of a verizon store and also witnessed what i did.  as those five flew to the north and appeared to dim out of sight into a cloud the man and i talked.  i told him i was in the army and never saw anything like that.  he replied he had spent twenty years in the air force and had never witnessed lights like those.  he went back in the store and i went back to my car.  i picked up the phone and called my wife just down the street. 

     just as she answered i witnessed the sixth light appear over the treeline.  i told her to get outside and look up.  her first words were "oh my god, it"s round!".  i poked my head in the verizon store and told the man inside who was describing it to his family there was another one.  he came back out in time to watch it from about half way through its visible flight path until it disappeared as the first five did.  it just dimmed into a distant cloud.  i asked the other witness about how far off the ground he would've guessed they were and he replied no more than 5,000 feet.  

     i have seen military flares, i have seen jets, and i have seen airplanes.  this was not any of those.  i even considered parts of that satellite that was due to burn in tonight but that was coming in at a 55 degree angle or something and this was moving too slow to be falling from space. 

     i went home and asked my wife what she saw and she described a round light almost directly above her.  she said when it entered a cloud she saw a distinct round shape around the light as if the light was just the center of a much larger round object.

     i called the centerville police dept. to see if anyone else had called anything in.  the dispatcher replied no.  i described to her exactly what i saw and she said she actually witnessed something very similar to that description about 15 miles away in farmersville, oh on her way into work.  she said she would log it in and we ended our conversation.

     i then contacted wright patterson afb base operations desk and asked if they had fired any flares.  he replied no foreseeing where i was going.  i described to him what i had witnessed and said  hate to be that guy, but there was definitely something in centerville.  he said "no man, we haven't had anything out in that area."  thus ended our conversation.
content.summary: Six lights observed by two retired military personnel in centerville, oh 9/23/11 2102hrs

content.detailedDescription: I was exiting my university facing north at about 745 and right away i noticed two bright what could have been dismissed as stars in the sky. however, it was still bright outside and i am accustomed to the sky and i knew that they weren't stars. i contacted a friend in austin and he verified that there were no stars north. as i traveled home i would momentarily lose sight but when i got home it appeared as if they didn't move. this took about 15 minutes so i knew they weren't planes, helicopters, or stars because it was brighter than any star i have seen and as the sun began to set the one directly north turned orange and began to disappear and the other just faded. i speculate that it was two objects reflecting the sun since the one closest to the west stayed brighter until the sun set. me and my roommate looked at google sky and found no charted visibly bright star in that region. i always look at the sky and i can tell you that it wasn't a star, plane, or anything of the sort.
content.summary: Two bright stationary lights north of lubbock that faded as the sun set

content.detailedDescription:
We were having a bonfire in our backyard on saturday evening, 9/17/11 with family and friends (northern indiana). it was a clear night with many stars when i happened to look up and see an orange "fireball" flying overhead. i had initially just glanced up at the stars, but the object quickly got my attention. i quickly pointed it out to the rest of the group and we all observed it making it's way across the sky above us.  it seemed to move in a straight path, was completely silent, and showed no trace of a "tail" or flames around it directly.  it was a solid, glowing orange. i grabbed my camera to take some pics and got one.  however, the detail in the photo is not good, but the "true" color comes thru nicely.  we all watched the object as it moved towards the west (it traveled east to west as best as i can tell, as it was already almost directly over us when i noticed it).  hard to tell what size/distance it was...But definitely large....And definitely obvious to the naked eye.  

a short time later, maybe 20 mins or so, we saw it again (or one just like it).  same description as before.  i once again pointed it out and everyone there observed it.  i did snap a couple more pics, but once again, little detail but great color. when i pointed the object out initially, all of us started speculating what it could possibly be...A meteor? satellite? i came inside to check the news online to see if there was anything mentioned about a meteor shower or observable satellite in our area, but could find nothing. we live in an area about 100 miles southeast of chicago, so we see a fair amount of air traffic...Definitely not any of that, tho.  i did observe a plane very shortly after one of the objects went by (can't remember which one) that seemed lower and with a different lighting pattern than the usual planes we see in our night skies.  i think that was a plane, just a different type than we see normally. 

we are all still baffled and no one there could determine what it was for certain...But none of us had ever seen anything like it before (age range of witnesses were 13-71).  it caused some excitement for us all, but especially for me because the curiousity about what it was just wouldn't go away.  i mentioned it on my facebook status and only one other friend said she had seen something in the sky that night as well that matched my description while she was driving back from purdue university to her home in goshen, in. she wanted to know what it was as well.  the object, and the second one, eventually faded from our view as it travelled beyond our line of sight heading in a westward direction. 

would really like to find out if there is an official explanation for what we saw because whatever it was it was stunning to see. kept waiting all week to hear about it on the news or from other people that might have seen the object(s), but nothing has ever been mentioned...If you know what it is, please let me know.
content.summary: Orange, glowing objects x2, sighted within 20-30 mins. of each other in northern in 9/17/11

content.detailedDescription: Looked up in the sky and a sliver football shaped craft hovering heard a plane sound but not coming from the object looked to my left and saw a plane looked back and the craft was making tight circles told my friend to come look at at this and looked back up and it was gone now i know what it feels like to see something and people say your crazy i dont care if anyone beleives me or not i know what i saw!!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Looked up in the sky and a sliver football shaped craft hovering

content.detailedDescription:
As reported to asd by phone: 

on monday night at about lopm, june the 27th, 2011 i was following my brother, who was driving a truck, in my car driving south on hwy 83 outside of wheatland missouri. the sky was completely overcast and it had rained some during the day. suddenly, i noticed five new bright star-like objects in a random pattern in the sky that had to be below the overcast. they were extremely bright and strangely defined with rays of light coming off of them in all directions.  they were multi-colored.  i checked my glasses to see if they could be causing this effect, but there was nothing wrong with them. at first the objects almost appeared to be stationary, but then i could tell that they were moving off in the same direction we were traveling. then they began popping off and on, seemingly random- appearing then disappearing. 

when we reached aa highway we and turned left (east) and they suddenly all vanished. i kept looking to my right and in about thirty seconds they came back on in a new uniform straight line. then they disappeared sequentially, one after the other. i jumped out of the car when we stopped at a stop sign and ran to my brother's truck to see if he saw the objects. he said no, but he did remember seeing something like what i described a few years ato. when we arrived at my brother's place in the country, 1 stood at the fence line looking off in the direction i had last seen them for several minutes. then, just as i was about to give up, i saw two lights come on at the horizon at a very low elevation. then independently, they went out. 

whiteman afb is off in that direction, so several days later i called to see if they knew anything about this. they knew nothing about it, but an information officer listened to my story, including the orange objects i had seen in kansas city. the person i was talking to did make the comment that he wished he could see a ufo.

i listened to the radio the rest of the day to see if the report would be repeated but it never was, and i never saw anything in the paper about it. however, there is an on-line site- missourimufon.Org that did list this report along with others and said that ufo sightings in the kansas city area have been increasing in recent months.
content.summary: Five multi-colored star-like objects stationary, then move across sky and dissapear

content.detailedDescription:
As reported to asd by phone and in writing today with slight editing:

on the evening of friday july 1st at midnight, i was driving through downtown kansas city, missouri on i-35 hwy heading north. i had just passed under bartle hall and could see the at&t building up ahead, when i suddenly noticed 3 orange, glowing, pulsating objects coming very low and straight towards me from the east. 

as the objects passed to the left of me and the line of traffic not more than 1/2 block from my position, i could see that they were about the size of small or midsize cars. one was lower than the other two and actually passed in front of the high rise buildings below their roof lines. the other two were slightly higher up. 

suddenly, the lower one veered up to the right to join the other two at which time they all disappeared over the roof lines going north. briefly, i could not see them, then they reappeared, coming back south at which
time they separated. one went south, one went west, and the other one just continued to circle over and down between the buildings. at this point, i was out on the shoulder with my car turned off watching this, when suddenly, out of the south, the other two returned, joined the third one, and then they all went straight north until i could no longer see them.

final thoughts on this sighting: their elevation i would estimate, varied from 35 feet to 73 feet.

their speed was probably about 75 mph or less, while i could see them, except when they took off to the north. at that point they may have been doing 100 mph or more. they had a glowing, plasma look to them and were rhythmically pulsating (in time with each other). they reminded me of giant fireflies. and upon reflection, i remember they had a reddish tinge at their centers and seemed to be somewhat bell shaped as seen from the side when they passed me on the left.

note from asd: due to the speed of the objects and directional change it is ulikely that these were sky lanterns.
content.summary: Orange pulsing objects over downtown kansas city change direction

content.detailedDescription:
My father and i had noticed the strange object on a few occasions over the past month and i decided to bring my ipad 2 with me on my next visit to my parent's house for dinner to use the astronomy apps on it to determine the identity of the object if it was a star or not. i also planned to take any pictures if possible. after dinner and awhile later when i was leaving, i almost forgot to look up for the light while leaving down the driveway when i saw it already high in the sky brighter than any star.

i felt anxious at the time to get my ipad out as quickly as possible in case the object disappeared. i had no doubts what i was seeing was something out of the ordinary because i do a lot of stargazing when i find the time most of my life. especially since there had not been any sightings in the area since 93-94.

i backed my car up the driveway and called my dad to come outside to see it. my mom and sister also saw it but were too nervous to stay outside so they went back inside while my dad and i took pictures and watched the object move slowly across the sky. sometimes the object would seem to come closer or further away judging by the existing landscape for reference points. the whole time it continuously blinked a series of colors extremely brightly, almost seeming to rotate but hard to determine at such a distance. unfortunately the colors of the lights did not come through on the photos i took. i took about a dozen pics but am sending only the least blurry of the bunch since i had no tripod and the second photo is an inverted color version. 

during the observation there was plenty of other planes flying high and low to compare the object to also and it was far larger and brighter than them. there was even a airforce c-130 cargo plane flying solo and low that passed through the area. usually they fly in pairs at least, but rarely if ever solo. while watching the object, we could faintly make out small orbs flying to and from the larger object but moving too fast and small to pick up on the camera. i also was not able to use the built-in video recorder on the ipad or iphone because it had no zoom like the camera does and there was a street light pole nearby causing glare.

we kept expecting the object to do something other than to move slowly about, but it never went out of view and i was pressed for time to head home so i had to leave. i have also heard from my mother since then that when fbi agents were interviewing her yesterday about a friend of mine who had applied to work for them, they asked her if she had happened to see the object in the eastern sky as i had described. my mom admitted seeing it and the agent agreed with her saying he felt it not to be a planet or known object.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: The object has been seen in the same area for the past month at relatively the same time with multiple witnesses.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving home from work along k-10. i was about a mile outside of lawrence, ks, maybe 2000 feet east of the e 1750 rd exit. i first noticed the object because it was floating in the sky in plain sight, within my eye-level. originally, i thought the object was a dark grey balloon of some sort, and it did look rather soft or organic, but as i looked at it, i noticed no tether nor insignia. it stayed stationary in the sky, and was visible for a few minutes as i approached it. when i turned a bend, however, and looked back up, it was gone, and i could no longer see it from any of my windows.
i found the whole experience quite strange, and felt a really odd sensation, like i was not supposed to see it or something. like i had to look away.
content.summary: Hovering sphere

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were comming back from the zoo on hwy 71 kids were sleeping. we were about 10 min north of st. joe when 3 white orbs passed us overhead. they were moving super fast and indipendently of each other. when i turned to look at my husband mark and i looked back on orb seemed to vanish. the other two keept moving at incredeble speeds towards the ssw. i couldnt tell if they fadded out or keeped going so fast they disapeard from sight. too low to be an airplane to siglent to be a helicopter(s) and just way too fast . you just know that what your seeing is not anything familiar. and was truly an amazing sight to behold. heather
content.summary: 3 glowing white orb objects flew over us and disapeared while we were driving

content.detailedDescription:
It's goin to be hard for me to explain the events in english, so i will do in  portuguese.
 
naquela noite, estavamos em seis eu, "j" ( namorada ), "ab" ( amigo ), duas de suas primas, uma de uns 24 anos na epoca ( vou chama-la de "a"), a outra prima de aproximadamente 15 anos ( sera chamada de "b") e um outro amigo deles que eu tambem vim a conhecer naquela noite ( o chamarei de "c").
noite de carnaval em todo o pais, e nos decidimos ir a praia que fica a uns 300 metros da casa do "ab", fomos de carro, aonde paramos a apenas alguns metros da agua, por sinal nessa praia a areia e bem dura entao eh normal pessoas dirigirem usando a areia da praia, e tambem nao exite praticamente ondas, voce pode andar na agua por algumas centenas de metros e o nivel daqua nao vai passar da tua coxa ou cintura.
gostaria de poder deixar as coordenadas geograficas mas ainda nao as consegui.
ok. chegamos a praia, todos fora do carro, "c" estava tocando violao, e todo mundo ali por perto, cantando e dancando quando "a" disse que iria para a agua. continuamos ali, alguns minutos se passaram, nossa amiga estava ha uns 30 metros de distancia, quando derepente uma luz toa forte, saindo de baixo d���gua iluminou todo o morro que fica ha nossa esquerda. a luz estava muito proximo a garota, foi quando comecamos a gritar: 
- sai da agua, sai sai, corre.
o morro que eu me refiro, deve ter uns cincoenta metros de altura, e foi praticamente todo iluminado por aquela luz branca e extremamente forte.
quando "a" voltou, perguntou para nos o que houve?! porque de onde estava nao conseguiu ver absolutamente nada, mas todos as outras pessoas viram a mesma intensa luz branca.
ficamos nos questionando por alguns momentos, quando uma outra luz mas agora no ceu e do lado oposto do nosso ponto de vista apareceu.
ano me lembro ao certo a ordem e nem mesmo as cores. se eu nao me engano uma era de cor branca e a outra acho que meio amarelada. 
bom como estava dizendo, uma apareceu no ceu, como que abaixo de uma nuvem, sumiu, depois apareceu outra luz mas em cima da nuvem, e ficaram assim por alguns momentos, e nos seis nos questionando que aquilo la poderia ser.
ficamos por la ate nao vermos mais nada, o que tambem nao durou muito tempo , acredito que tudo nao passou de uns dez minutos tudo junto.
pode paracer bobeira mas essa e a primeira vez que escrevo sobre o assunto, e como se estivesse aliviado em por no "papel", para alguem com entendimento no assunto posso ver mais um avistamento. espero que tenha sido util.
content.summary: Luzes debaixo d'agua

content.detailedDescription:
Daughter of 26, her boyfriend, and myself were returning from a nearby town.  we stopped in to say hello to friends whose house is on the highway we were on--hwy 11.  the husband and wife and their 10-year-old son came out and the six of us stood there about an hour on the porch talking.  across the road from their house is farmland, some trees, and a radio antennae.  nothing was blocking the sky.
suddenly someone said, "what the heck is that?"
i turned around to look and two lights appeared in the sky, looking like the size of stars.  they were white.  one was higher than the other, and further ahead.  they weren't up in the sky like stars, they were way across the field and then up in the air.  hard to say how high, but we were looking up at them.  it was very dark out.
then all of a sudden a couple of brass-colored/gold-colored/bright circles just showed up.  they seemed to occupy the space differently than the white lights, which began to move to the right.  then the white lights blinked out.  when the white lights blinked back in, they were still moving.  the metallic-colored objects seemed to blink in and then went out, then came back in again.  two came in, then a couple more, then another one.  at one point there were 5 or 6 of these very bright metallic colored "things" visible.  then the white lights went out and came back, and they were still moving toward canton.  our friend's house is about two miles outside town.
a few of the metallic "things" blinked out for good, but a couple of them began traveling toward canton and were traveling, as my daughter said, very fast."
i had turned around to say something to my friend, and when i turned back, the objects were gone.  i didn't see the metallic objects 
moving toward canton.  they were gone by the time i turned back around.
content.summary: Two white lights appeared in the sky.  then a series of brassy/goldish/yellow objects appeared, seemed to move briefly, then went out and came back.  eventually the colored things and the two white things blinked out and were gone.

content.detailedDescription: Approximately 9:30 p.M. on september 13, 2011 i took the dogs outside on my property.  while walking back towards my house i noticed a bright, white-lit, round object appear over my head and travel in a straight line due east.  the object disappeared just short of reaching the tree line.  i immediately assumed it was a meteorite, but i realized that it had no tail.  i then assumed it to be a satellite or the space station, but it was too large.
content.summary: Large bright white-lit round object traveling east

content.detailedDescription:
July 12, 2011, 8:30p.M.Cdt raytown, mo 

i live in a wooded area between 2 cities with the woods being approximately 10 miles square. i have a nice, unobstructed view of the sky. i was taking pictures of the clouds as i do quite often.  i was facing ene.  i noticed an anomaly in the clouds.  i saw a perfectly straight line which appeared to be in front of and abruptly hiding the altocumulus clouds.  i was immediately calling it a cloaking device of a ufo.

i took 7 photos, 4 showed an object(s) with or at the front of the cloaking device.  i did not notice the object/reflections until i down loaded the photos.  there appeared to be one object with the front reflecting the sun as if off a window or metallic material.  i believed it to be a reflection. the ufo became more apparent as the clouds moved. the object was stationary based on the sequence of photos i took.

i was freaking out with joy.  i ran inside to show my boyfriend the pictures i took.  what i saw did not seem natural. i've been a believer nearly my whole life.  ive been looking for my "ufo experience" for over 30 yours.  i was glad to have taken these photos.  but now i don't feel quite the same.  i've been feeling like i'm being watched.  it's just an eerie feeling i get now and then.

i live near  (approximatly 7 miles) a nuclear power plant.  i'm also 3 hours north of whiteman air force base where the stealth bombers are base out of. there have been enough ufo reports that the kansas city star featured a front page article onsunday, september 4th, 2011.

my photos were taken at 8:28p.M, 8:29p.M. and 8:30p.M. on july 12, 2011.  the photos have not been altered.  i used a fujia230 using the auto focus setting.

thank you for your time and interest.
content.summary: A cloud formation had a perfectly straight line abuptly cutting off altocumulus clouds.  not until i downloaded my photos did i see the shining object(s) in the cloud.

content.detailedDescription:
The event occurred last saturday 9-17-2011 

in the early afternoon.  i was taking digital photographs from the roof terrace of the new museum located on bowery in manhattan's lower east side.  i was shooting a series of images of the downtown manhattan skyline to get some pictures of the freedom tower construction.

because i had no tripod i was shooting at a very fast exposure rate 1/500th of a second.  in addition i was shooting in continuous mode at a frame rate of about 4 frames per second. i took my pictures and left the location.

last night upon looking at the images, i noticed a diamond shaped object moving very close to the horizon in four frames of my images.

on closer inspection i notices what appeared to be regular markings and windows on the craft.  i had to be moving at an incredible rate of speed for it to have moved as far as it did give the frame rate it was captured at.

it seems to be faintly emitting both blue and red light from the openings on it's back area.

a helicopter was also present in the nearby vicinity.

at first i thought it was a flag or something, but soon realized there was no flag  pole and from frame to frame it's shape stays regular.

i'm hoping an expert in this type of thing can help me to rule out any other possible explanations for what they think this might be.

please contact me a.S.A.P. as i am curious to get another opinion, especially an expert one.

the three images i have supplied are lower resolution details of the actual four images that were taken as described above.
content.summary: Taking photographs of downtown manhattan skyline i captured and extremely fast moving craft of some sort.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving in the vicinity of paso robles ca and pulled off the highway onto an unknown rural road to get some rest. the night was so clear, i stepped out of my car to enjoy the lack of urban sky glow.  i am an amateur astronomer, and a long-time sky-watcher and satellite watcher. i've experimented with astrophotography and consider myself to be a sane and intelligent individual.
   looking up, i noticed an extra "star" in the handle of  the big dipper. i did a double-take thinking it must be a passing plane or satellite and watched as two lights about a degree apart went from being stationary and started moving west, then did an abrupt u-turn and shot out of sight at a speed that was remarkable. i don't know of any man-made phenomenon that would explain this.
content.summary: Twin lights that appeared to be an extra star in the big dipper.

content.detailedDescription: I was looking outside in our back yard to see the stars , i seen this object in the distance with a glowing light . i run inside to get my viedo recorder, i  called my husband to look at this light , it started to get small then big , going from side to side , up & down . i zoom it in when the object would get bigger , that's when i noticed the pulsing lights  under the object .We keep asking each other "what's that" . after a while i just could not  believe what i just got on film , the object just disappeared and  i have it on video .. i still am unsure of what this is but i know it something
content.summary: Object pulsing , ring of lights ,

content.detailedDescription:
I am not sure what it was and i don't know who to report this to as this is something i have never seen before. i was driving around 5:24 a.M. through the chino/chino hills area westbound on the 60 freeway headed toward the 57 freeway. i looked up and seen flashes of light that appeared orange-ish (like orange sherbet.) the lights were behind a group of clouds. i kept looking up to see if anything was falling, ascending, traveling left or right and i seen nothing. the lights didn't go anywhere. the flshing reminded me of lightning, but the flashes weren't brigh enough to be lightning as it only lit up a small area of the sky behind the clouds, not the entire sky like lighning would. 

i have witnessed on 2 or 3 occasions near the same area, a light in the sky that made me think it was an airplane, but it just sat still for a long time. then it proceeded to move and take off vey quickly and disappear. so, in short, this is not the first time i witnessed something strange in this area.
content.summary: Orange flashing lights in the sky behind a group of clouds for a few seconds

content.detailedDescription: on the evening of september 14, 2011 (the evening a fireball was seen from san diego, ca, las vegas nevada  to arizona & new mexico) i was sitting out in the back yard talking with my two sons.  i was facing south/west and my two sons were in front facing me on opposite sides of the porch.  as we were talking i noticed behind my son who was on my right in front and facing me a very large and bright glowing green light through the tree that was on the west side of the yard.  as i talked i watched it getting closer and as it came in view past the tree i saw that it was an extremely bright green ball of light.  i immediately stood up and at the same time pointed and said  "look at that!" and both my sons looked and saw the same thing i was seeing.  as we watched, it was going parallel to the ground at what looked to be about the height of the two story house across the road or maybe a bit higher.  we watched it til it was at about to the half way point of my son���s  brick fence which faces south and we could see it was a ball shape, brilliant green, with what i can only describe as golden sparklers coming out the  back end of the "fireball" (right side.)  you could clearly see the sparks. there was no sound, and no smell, however, i heard a soft hissing sound for about 1 second which abruptly stopped at the same time it suddenly and instantly  disappeared right in front of our eyes.  i���m trying to think how to describe how big this object was and the best i can come up with without knowing what it���s actual size and how far away it was for sure is this green fireball looked about the size of a baseball held in your hand at arms length toward the sky.  it was that close and that big.  to me it seemed awfully slow for a meteorite and it was going straight across from west to east parallel to the ground instead of falling or on an angle.  it looked to me to be within a block or so of the house, but one of my son's says he thought it was more like about a mile away.  it���s hard to tell for sure when you don���t know the size of the object.  my first thought when i was watching it come towards me was that someone had shot a huge fourth of july rocket straight down the street behind my son's house.  it was definitely very close, or very huge, to see it the size we saw it. this was seen from the town of maricopa, az at somewhere around 7:45pm.  i didn't think to look at my watch. i saw it for maybe 10-15 seconds, seemed longer though, and my sons for less than that amount of time. it almost seemed in slow motion to me. you could actually see the golden colored sparks flashing like a sparkler behind it, the rest was a  brilliant green ball with possibly a bit of blue.  very exciting to see!    fantastic experience for sure!
content.summary: Green fireball maricopa, az   sept 14, 2011

content.detailedDescription: Woke up at 4:30am to use te restroom. the blinds to the bathroom window are always up so we can see the backyard in the evenings. the window faces east. i walked into the bathroom and glanced out the window. there was a square object about 500 ft away in the sky. i say a swayed object only because the lights that illuminated it were in a square shape. the 4 lights were solid with other lights in the middle of the box that blinked underneath it. it flew very fast and was heading east, then turned south and headed towards the airport. it could definitely have been a plane but none that i have ever seen before and it was not flying in the usual flight path of most other planes i watch that land at mccarran.
content.summary: Watched as the object seemed to land-somewhere near the airport.

content.detailedDescription:
I was on my way home from dropping my girlfriend off near williamsburg rd in sandston, va. as i was turning off williamsburg rd onto drybrdige rd i noticed a blinking light far away. i continued down this road towards meadow rd, i could still see the light blinking above the treetops. i took a right and headed down meadow to the bridge the goes over i-295. as i reached the overpass i stopped the truck on the side of it( stupid, i know ) and there was a pulsating white light over 295, it was bright enough to light up the surrounding clouds. i sat there long enough to note that it was pulsating at the same rate, it was a white sphere the whole thing would light up at even intervals. i mean this thing was bright white, pure white. at this time i was panicking and rode home to tell my mother, she wanted to go see it. about the time she was getting in my truck we heard the roaring of jet engines at richmond international airport (the military base over there, they have f-22's etc etc ) i have never heard the jets take off so late at night before. as we made our way to the bridge you could hear the jets still firing up, one after another, there was atleast 3 to 4 that took off. upon reaching the overpass the light was gone. my mother looked at me like i was crazy, but she did hear the jets taking off. and i am posting this because i searched va ufo on google recently and found an article where this person had the same sightings, and this is where i found this form to fill out. ironically, the same kind of sighting, same thing happening, in two different time frames?  i saw this early september 2011 and this person saw it in april 2011.

http://www.Examiner.Com/ufo-in-national/military-jets-follow-virginia-ufo

once i read that article i was like !!!!That's what i saw!!!!
content.summary: Flashing light over i-295

content.detailedDescription: Me and two of my friends were heading to a nearby city for some food. it was about 7pm, as we were driving down the road we can see a wide view of the sky, there were no stars out yet, but there was one really bright looking "star". i joked and said something like "hey look at that ufo" as a joke, and as we all looked again at the light, a second bright light appeared in the distance, and moved toward the other light. when the second light reached the first one, it stopped and the first light flew off and in a couple seconds faded out completely. after we ate at the fast food joint, we started driving down near an intersection at power and pecos and pulled over, when in the distance we saw 3 strange lights in the sky, which were stationary, then moved and made multiple formations (such as lines). out of the three lights, the one on the right started drifting further away from the other two, as the other two drifted further way from each other, a forth light appeared in between those. these are the pictures i have, they are not that great, but at least its something. all three of us saw the same thing.
content.summary: Strange lights over chandler/gilbert, az
